column4: Description

You are capable of making skill gems and item sockets to apply them to different objects. You also have encyclopedic knowledge of all skill gems from the Path of Exile game and skills at how to use them.

You are capable of making various flasks from the Path of Exile game. You also have encyclopedic knowledge of them and a general idea of how to use them. Their way of working is highly inspired by the in-game mechanics.

You can spend additional time and resources to apply higher quality to the targeted item, inspired by Path of Exile game mechanics. It is harder to do with types of items that are not included in the game as part of the Quality mechanic. The process is also more tedious and costly, proportional to the complexity and power of the targeted item. Quality is easier to apply when you create an item from scratch.

You can apply modifiers inspired by the Path of Exile game mechanic to your creations. Anything you made yourself - such as a device, weapon, armor, landmark, creature, etc. - is a valid target for applying a modifier, while its a in a process of being made by you. However, it works best on things similar to the entities modified usually in the original game. The cost in time and resources also scales proportionally with the power of the modifiers and the nature of the targeted creation.

"Beastcrafting is a method of crafting by sacrificing beasts to the blood altar in the Menagerie. Each beastcrafting recipe requires four beasts to be sacrificed, with most of them requiring one or two specific Red Beast, and the rest any Rare Beast. The four chosen beasts are released into the arena surrounding the blood altar and must be killed to complete the recipe. If the player dies during the attempt, the recipe fails and the beasts are lost." - Now you have the ability to use this mechanic in form of a ritual.

This perk gives you a random unique bow from the Path of Exile game and the ability to create this specific bow. If you roll the same bow again from this perk, you gain a bit more insight into the actual magic and science behind its creation or the ability to modify the original recipe a little. It gradually reveals more with each repetition. You don't have to summon your prize instantly - you can hold onto it until a better time comes. This perk can be purchased multiple times.
